panels.description: The percentage of the total usable space for object data that has been used for the site
panels.title: Data space usage breakdown

panels.description: The percentage of the total allowed space for object metadata that has been used for the site
panels.title: Metadata allowed space usage breakdown

panels.description: The amount of space used for user data during the selected time frame.
panels.title: Data storage over time

panels.description: The number of S3-specific operations performed. You can use this information to monitor your system's workloads and efficiencies.
panels.title: S3 operations

panels.description:
**Received**: The rate at which data is being received.

**Transmitted**: The rate at which data is being sent.

For troubleshooting, these values can help establish a general baseline for network performance.
panels.title: Network traffic

panels.description: The number of S3 API requests received during the selected time frame.
panels.title: S3 API requests

panels.description:
- Bad request: 400
- Forbidden: 403
- Not found: 404

You can use these metrics to ensure platform services are working. Unexpected values might mean a platform service is incorrectly configured, or they might indicate an external problem such as a network issue.
panels.title: Error rate (requests/second)

panels.description: Provides a 3-minute moving average of request durations, broken down by request type (GET, PUT, and DELETE). Each request duration starts when a request header is parsed by the Load Balancer service and ends when the complete response body is returned to the client.
panels.title: Average request duration (non-error)
